WorkItem.ClosedComment: This seems to be fixed in the latest sources. Please reactivate the issue if you still see this in the next release (0.8.1.0, should be out soon). If you do still see the issue,  please attach a sample file as we've had problems specific to how the input file was encoded. Thanks!
WorkItem.Description: Special characters, e.g. the swedish characters åäö, are not correctly represented in the generated .js file. If I open the generated js file in notepad and "Save as" Unicode the characters are represented correctly, but next time I change my ts file the encoding is overwritten.

Comments.Message: I have confirmed that it is fixed in 0.8.1. Thank you.
The problem is back on version 0.9

Same thing here with 0.8.3.1, any umlaut will get broken. There's a couple of issues on encoding around on the issue tracker, yet none of the tickets provides a working solution.
I'm sorry, but improper encoding is a no-go nowadays, especially when the rest of the typescript project is so good.

Any fix would be _highly_ appreciated.

Thank you for your work!
